title: Negotiation
author: Negotiation
content: A short story bitcointalk.org with my family....new year 2023bitcointalk.org is the place here are many memories of my life and many emotions are involved, I missed some time but I can not connected alwase, Because I have had to go through some very difficult times in my life, all of which may not be possible to say. So many things have happened in my life that many things have been lost from my life.Life has to go with both good and bad but losing some people for life is more painful for me ! After all this I have been able to spread the love of bitcoin to my family and relatives.Share some memorable image.This is a photo of my toddler with the bitcoin (bite) cake.Thanks all.Please pray for me.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: This has got nothing to do with bitcointalk, but the second most memorable thing that happened to me this year (the first would be way too long to explain and I don't have any pics) was coming across an abandoned guinea pig while I was out picking up scrap in the middle of the night.  The temperature was about 35 degrees Fahrenheit, and as I was opening the gate to a stall where a dumpster would have been stored, there it was in its cage, silent and obviously very cold.  This was in back of an abandoned dollar store, so the poor thing would have died had I not taken him home.That was in November, and though I thought about reaching out to an animal rescue to take him I decided to keep the little sucker.  So I did, and my cats find him amusing because he makes noises that range from a police siren to some kind of liquid bubbling over.  The pic above was taken right when I found him, and he only had 1.5 small carrots in his cage, and his food bowl was turned upside down.  The door was also wide open, and I think some other animal would have found him and had a tasty piggy meal.Animals really lift the spirits, and I needed that this year.

comments.author: Negotiation
comments.body: Quote from: The Sceptical Chymist on January 01, 2023, 06:39:50 PMThis has got nothing to do with bitcointalk, but the second most memorable thing that happened to me this year (the first would be way too long to explain and I don't have any pics) was coming across an abandoned guinea pig while I was out picking up scrap in the middle of the night.  The temperature was about 35 degrees Fahrenheit, and as I was opening the gate to a stall where a dumpster would have been stored, there it was in its cage, silent and obviously very cold.  This was in back of an abandoned dollar store, so the poor thing would have died had I not taken him home.That was in November, and though I thought about reaching out to an animal rescue to take him I decided to keep the little sucker.  So I did, and my cats find him amusing because he makes noises that range from a police siren to some kind of liquid bubbling over.  The pic above was taken right when I found him, and he only had 1.5 small carrots in his cage, and his food bowl was turned upside down.  The door was also wide open, and I think some other animal would have found him and had a tasty piggy meal.Animals really lift the spirits, and I needed that this year.Yeap, you have done is definitely commendable and as I said before Bitcointalk has a lot to do with it, as I was in my studies without Bitcointalk I could not have completed my academic career. There are so many other things that need more time to tell, Bitcoin is definitely a place of passion for me.Last sendable merits keep your post... Edited.

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: Despite am quite aware about many threads created for the celebration of new year and seing this also gives me an interpretation for just a repetition of what others had earlier done before, but your creativity in designing the cake was purposely on bitcoin talk of which i still think it's like a birthday cake more presentable for bitcoin itself when it had a celebration on the 3rd of January, but nevertheless i message is passed across that  you're celebrating the new year with bitcointalk but I don't know how each member of this community can partake in this your well decorated cake, but i believe the forum will appreciate your contributions to the community better than presenting a shallow ideas in your meriments to the community to see without learning anything from it or your forum's contributions.

comments.author: NdaMk
comments.body: Quote from: Aanuoluwatofunmi on January 05, 2023, 05:29:49 PMDespite am quite aware about many threads created for the celebration of new year and seing this also gives me an interpretation for just a repetition of what others had earlier done before, but your creativity in designing the cake was purposely on bitcoin talk of which i still think it's like a birthday cake more presentable for bitcoin itself when it had a celebration on the 3rd of January, but nevertheless i message is passed across that  you're celebrating the new year with bitcointalk but I don't know how each member of this community can partake in this your well decorated cake, but i believe the forum will appreciate your contributions to the community better than presenting a shallow ideas in your meriments to the community to see without learning anything from it or your forum's contributions. Even though we can't be there to celebrate with him and have a taste of the ostensibly delicious cake, he has left us with a wonderful message. Not only us, but other platforms where he must have shared this pictures, such as social media platforms, must have seen the bitcointalk.org, which will make them curious as to why it's been decorated on the cake. These can lead them here, where they may become interested in learning about bitcoin. I hope you have a better memory on the forum this year than last.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: It's been a few days since New Year and I am happy that even though I am not rich but I think it is my lucky day or month. I don't gamble too much since I am a small time gambler but I am glad that I am lucky to be able to win about $200. So, I would say that hope that this 2023 year will be good for you guys too. Even though we are not there to celebrate with you but remember that we are here in this forum celebrating New year.

comments.author: Getmon
comments.body: Reading op and Chymist posts, I got the message that I also need an upliftment in my life, which seems to be getting more and more common and losing its color. After attempting to become a hermit last year, Yahoo's suggestion to conduct routine health checks woke me up. Bless that man for his coming operation. We have all had challenges in life over the past few years, and we pray for a good 2023. This year, I feel more optimistic. I visited a zoo to start the year. Additionally, I will have a general health checkup sooner. This year, I intend to travel and enjoy life more. Wishing us all a rock solid 2023!

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: Negotiation on January 01, 2023, 06:11:29 PMA short story bitcointalk.org with my family....new year 2023Life has to go with both good and bad but losing some people for life is more painful for me ! After all this I have been able to spread the love of bitcoin to my family and relatives.Share some memorable image.Thanks all.Please pray for me.Seeing this beautiful cake with an inscription design about bitcointalk did catch my attention, as it actually shows that out there there lies someone who cares about the forum and the people there in, because 2022 was literally not an easy year for both Bitcoin and the world economy at large, but moreover, here we are in a brand new year 2023, which is indeed a privilege, as no one knows yet what the new year hold for us all. So I pray you get well soon.

comments.author: Peanutswar
comments.body: Happy new year everyone it's my third year here in the community and seeing a lot of contributions of other members and sees a lot of events hoping and wish we got all recover from the mistakes that happened last year, its been a while since I've seen a really nice cake here in the community, one of my memorable thing is I achieve close to have a 1 bitcoin, hoping this year will achieve this target.

comments.author: WatChe
comments.body: Quote from: Peanutswar on January 07, 2023, 03:46:13 PMHappy new year everyone it's my third year here in the community and seeing a lot of contributions of other members and sees a lot of events hoping and wish we got all recover from the mistakes that happened last year, its been a while since I've seen a really nice cake here in the community, one of my memorable thing is I achieve close to have a 1 bitcoin, hoping this year will achieve this target.I reciprocate the same to everyone out there on bitcointalk.org. It's my second new year here, and I have learned many things here in these two years. Every moment spend on this forum is worthy since you are increasing your knowledge. It's a new year and everyone hoping to see a good year from bitcoin perspective. There are many speculations about bitcoin price, hopes are high that it will be a good year.

comments.author: UserU
comments.body: Quote from: The Sceptical Chymist on January 01, 2023, 06:39:50 PMThis has got nothing to do with bitcointalk, but the second most memorable thing that happened to me this year (the first would be way too long to explain and I don't have any pics) was coming across an abandoned guinea pig while I was out picking up scrap in the middle of the night.  The temperature was about 35 degrees Fahrenheit, and as I was opening the gate to a stall where a dumpster would have been stored, there it was in its cage, silent and obviously very cold.  This was in back of an abandoned dollar store, so the poor thing would have died had I not taken him home.My god, those things squeal really cute! I happened to watch some video from this famous YouTube channel called The DoDo and I didn't really expect them to sound like that.

comments.author: PowerGlove
comments.body: Just leaving this here as a reference link for trust feedback I've left for OnZen.OnZen tried to cheat during the 1st Bitcointalk Pie Baking contest (which pisses me off even more than it normally would, because I contributed to the prize pool). There was actually an earlier attempt at cheating (now edited). Anyway, I was catching up on unread topics in Meta and after reading the OP I now see where OnZen lifted the "B" from. Sneaky bastard.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote from: PowerGlove on April 06, 2023, 02:24:02 AMJust leaving this here as a reference link for trust feedback I've left for OnZen.Sneaky bastard. Why is it left without a red tag?https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5439781.msg61878463#msg61878463

comments.author: PowerGlove
comments.body: Quote from: lovesmayfamilis on April 06, 2023, 06:14:31 AMWhy is it left without a red tag?https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5439781.msg61878463#msg61878463I don't know if I can bring myself to dignify that pathetic attempt with trust feedback. With OnZen, it's cut-and-dried cheating: they did it more than once, they tried to hide their first attempt, and I interacted with them in the thread, so I have some sense of their intentions. With MamunMKY, things are less clear; maybe they misunderstood the competition or were trying to make a joke, I don't know. I mean, it obviously looks like an attempt at cheating to me, but I can't be certain and I don't want to get into the habit of leaving speculative feedback.
